content.description: <math alttext="C u C l 2 aqueous reacts to produce C u solid plus C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CuCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>Cu</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The diagram above shows the apparatus used for the electrolysis of <math alttext="C u C l 2 aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CuCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> according to the chemical equation given. Which of the following mathematical expressions can be used to calculate the current required to produce <math alttext="0.125 mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.125</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="C u solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> in 1 hour?

choices.label: <math alttext="I equals, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 2 times 0.125 times 96485, and denominator 3600, close parenthesis, amperes" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mn>0.125</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mn>96</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>485</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>600</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
